Dead Rising 2 is a game that drops you in the middle of a zombie infested mall, with your ability to concoct the strangest weapon in existence as your only weapon. The greatest asset of this game is the ways in which you can take the environement, and destroy hordes of zombies with it. With some of the most enjoyable weapons in games, memorable and challenging boss battles, some of the best coop gameplay I've seen in years, time management mechanics that add replayability, great controls, some nice visuals for the time of its release, a lovable Capcom style campy story and cheesy dialogue that keeps you anticipating the next one-liner, Dead Rising 2 offers hours and multiple playthroughs of fun.  I'm also glad to say that the PC port is the superior version minus the lack of availability of the Case West DLC, and is actually one of the best PC ports I've played in a while. The PC controls are intuitive, the graphics are a step up from its console iterations, and the patches for the game's major issues on release (saving kicking coop partner and inability for coop partner to save progress are examples) is included.  The game has its problems however, which I think are necessary to point out for the sake of the reader and potential buyer. The first is the overabundance of quick-time-events. I honestly consider QTEs to be a bad mechanic 100% of the time, due to it stripping the gameplay to, 'press x to watch what happens next' or, 'press x to not die.' Unfortunately this game makes you go through one everytime a zombie gets his hands on you. The button prompt changes everytime, so you can't just anticipate it and get it over with quickly, luckily the prompts are always one of the movement keys or waving the mouse around. The PC port's use of Game for Windows Live is probably the PC version's second greatest flaw. Games for Windows Live is horribly unoptimized, and is a chore to use in comparison to Steam. Another issue is one I previously mentioned, the fact that the Case West DLC has not been ported, and is not available on PC, so if playing Case West is a must for you, you might want to consider getting this game for PS3 or Xbox 360, although I'd argue it isn't worth the sacrifices made for the console versions. Two very minor complaints are Chuck's slow movement speed, because sometimes I find myself getting impatient with Chuck's inability to go faster than a jog, and how New Game+ doesn't up the difficulty any. I will say however, that New Game+ is fun in the way that you can try and complete all of the missions before their timers run out, due to you being much stronger.  Despite its issues, Dead Rising 2 rounds out to be a wonderful game, that I whole-heartedly recommend buying.

Welcome fellow ZOMBIE hunters to Dead Rising, 2. In this adventure you play as protagonist, motocross champion Charles Greene who prefers to be called chuck. Chuck participates in controversial games called “Terror is Reality” in Fortune City, Nevada in hopes to win prize money to buy a drug called Zombrex which needs to be administered every 24 hours to young and out of place daughter, Katey. If she does not receive her injection she dies and turns into a ZOMBIE. Right after the 1st tournament a horde of ZOMBIES get loose all over the city & Chuck is forced into a position to search for Zombrex. During this time he’ll come across other survivors to rescue & psychopaths to defeat. & all along the way must survive himself an overwhelming amount of Undead ZOMBIES. Single player or Co-Op, you’ll be able to play thru again after the end to continue leveling and gain new weapons and combo weapons. The game offers a large range of individual stories and is very violent and dangerous.

A very silly zombie game.  Gameplay is pretty great, its always fun to find out that you can combine a paddle with some chainsaws slaughter 100 zombies with it. :D  The story is interesting with a lot of secret stuff and plot twists, however the animation and voice acting makes the caracters boring and stiff. Also there is next to none voice acting outside of cutscenes, everything is done by text... Chuck's writing is also terrible, they tried to make a badass caracter who says badass one liners do badass stunts and kills thousands of zombies in a badass way. They failed completely. Chuck's classic one liners include: 'Wich one of you punks where throwing trash at me?' and 'Hey poindexters!' Its awful. You can dress up Chuck in very silly ways and he will wear those clothes in the cutscenes. Its pretty funny to see Chuck trying to be a badass in short shorts and a showgirl hat.  The setting is perfect, its a giant entertainment plaza with countless shops and slot machines and with lots and lots of secrets to find. There is so much stuff to do that you it is impossible to see it all in a normal playthrough.  Some complaints is the saving system wich involves you going to the toilet and taking a ♥♥♥♥. Its so easy to forget to save often that when you die you might have to replay maybe 1 hour of gameplay. Its very annoying as you sometimes randomly run into minibosses that kill you very quickly and then have to restart. So remember to SAVE ALL THE TIME! Every time in the safe house and every time you pass a toilet. If you don't do it you WILL regret it.  The minibosses and regular bosses are poorly designed and require you to play in a very specific way most of the time. I suggest you look up guides on youtube.(roosterteeth has some good ones)  Also women are highly sexualised in this game. Many have big breasts and little clothing and the game designers are not afraid of showing them off. The camera often pans over their breasts or behind and at one part of the game a woman bent over to lockpick a door and was clearly exposing her bottom to Chuck. Chuck even comments on this with 'You have some interesting qualities'. Personally I don't have a problem with a little ♥♥♥♥ and ♥♥♥ in my videogames but it is something you might want to consider.   This game also uses games for windows live  Overall a good game with some issues. Worth a play!

A solid and fun game all around, made me laugh several times thanks to its macabre humour. Technically complex and well made from animations to object and scenery variety. It's rather difficult though, since the original gameplay is intended to last about 7 hours. I ended up playing with a time changing trainer that multiplied the timer by 4. Thanks to this, the predetermined timeouts for game missions was delayed, and I could enjoy bashing zombies and exploring.  Only weak point are boss fights, which are quite a few and often one sided and stupidly arranged, so that you basically lose if you don't bring the right weapon.  Great cutscenes; zombie dismemberment; good audio and graphics. Certainly the best zombie game I've played.

Dead Rising 2 is a great successor to the original Dead Rising. With a crafting system that allows players to create weapons out of random junk they find lying around to battle the hordes of zombies quite literally biting at your heels, is somewhat satisfying. The story itself being that it is a Capcom game could be taken with a grain of salt, but none the less it is engaging enough to want you to keep playing.   To be fair the PC port of this game I find to be the best version to play this game, what with the smoother frame rates, better graphics, and the option to use a controller or mouse and keyboard. Most people would think that mouse keyboard would fall under controller in a game like this but I actually though the port did a very good job tightening up the controls.  The multiplayer co-op this game features really nails in the enjoyment factor for this game, not only can you look like a psychopath but you can have a friend doing the same right alongside you. I would most certainly give this game a try especially with friends.

I mostly liked the game because it was amusing to pick up cash registers and kill zombies with them until the money popped out, then dressing my character in the most ridiculous clothes I could find. I did NOT like the time limit on some missions, but that's just me, some people like that kind of stuff. It was a fairly good game, if you like mindlessly killing things, get it, but if you're in it for a deep, The Last of Us level storyline (and don't like timed missions) this game isn't for you.

A pretty bad port of the console version.  The game itself was awesome and I had a blast with it.  However even though it was developed primarily for consoles, it has no controller support for windows, and the keys can't be changed without editing some config files.  Also for some people apparently the volume is stuck low and the only way to make it louder is to crank your speakers, which can be a problem for headphone users.  It has a coop mode that still has the odd person around to play with, although everyone I managed to play with was kind of laggy.  I'm sad that Capcom won't rerelease it without GFWL, but considering how lazy of a port it was, I totally understand their position.  Play it while you still can!

Good for a laugh if you're bringing along a friend. Playing alone may get stale quickly. The constantly depleting timer can get tiresome as you're forced to hurry yourself along rather than enjoying everything the game has to offer. Trying to kill zombies and have fun with a friend on borrowed time is extremely frustrating in a game that begs you to run around, experiment, and waste time. You're either playing the game to win (not so fun), or wasting time with friends and completely screwing up the campaign story. Stressing about time management is best left for the real world, not here. Outside of that, playing this game with a friend makes the time issue bearable.

This was my first time playing this game, it passed me by when it was first on consoles. Love it, love it, love it! The core gameplay is fun and surprisingly addicting; I kept finding myself saying 'just one more mission/survivor/psychopath.' There's a story, and it's fairly decent, but it doesn't take itself overly seriously or get in the way of anything. Which is good, considering you can go all Darth Maul with two chainsaws duct taped to both ends of a kayak paddle. The whole thing is a lot of dark comedy and ridiculous fun, I highly recommend it.

Dead Rising 2 is an incredibly fun zombie sandbox mode game where you can just casually sit back, slice some zombies in half, and also get invested in the really great story! I love this game, it adds so much to the franchise from the first game, with Combo Weapons, and more vehicles, and it is just a fun game overall! Also, not to mention the humour behind the developers of this game, there are so many funny little moments in this game with the psychopaths and all the characters in general. This game gave me a real good laugh, and it has plenty of replayability with 5 different endings! This game is just a great game where you can sit back and have a great time without the game getting too intense, like CoD or something. This game is a reccommended purchase. 9/10
